metrics_preference.title: Metrics reporting preference
metrics_preference.description: Help improve CodeRibbon and contribute to academic usability research by enabling completely anonymous and non-identifiable usage reporting!

enum.description: Disabled - entire metrics system is disabled.
Not yet implemented: Send metrics events directly to the official CodeRibbon metrics analysis server.
Store metrics events in RAM, which can then be exported to file for later analysis.
Automatic: Use your preference for the editor's Preferred Line Width
Automatic: Use the Minimum Characters Wide setting below
Manual: Use a specific number of horizontal patches.

pane_count_horizontal_min_chars.title: Automatic: Minimum Characters Wide
pane_count_horizontal_min_chars.description: Choose how many columns a patch needs to show at minimum in order to be useful. Please change the above setting to activate this.

pane_count_horizontal_number.title: Manual: Number of horizontal patches
pane_count_horizontal_number.description: Choose an exact number of patches to show per screen horizontally. This setting is also is used as the fallback in case automatic width detection fails.

pane_count_vertical_number.title: Number of Patches per Column
pane_count_vertical_number.description: How many vertical patches should new columns be initialized with?

pane_creation_strategy.title: Placement of newly opened files
pane_creation_strategy.description: When adding items to the ribbon without any empty patches on-screen, where should they be created?

enum.description: Always at the end of the ribbon, leaving prior empty patches alone
Create a new column right next to your currently focused one
Find the closest empty patch rightwards of your current position
Add a patch to the current column

autoscroll_timeout.title: Delay until columns are auto-aligned to screen
autoscroll_timeout.description: Wait this number of seconds after scrolling to automatically align the viewport to the nearest patch column. Set to zero to disable the auto-snapping to columns. Values between 0 and 0.5 are not recommended for physical scrollwheel users.

distance_cutoff.title: Max distance to align
distance_cutoff.description: How close do you have to be to a column for the auto-snap to align? You can express this either as a percentage (of the current column width) or as a number of pixels.
